meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a tuber.
meanings.sent1: The tuberous roots of the plant store nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The farmer planted tuberous vegetables in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The tuberous potato rolled off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her tuberous fingers grasped the pen tightly.
meanings.sent5: The tuberous growth on the tree trunk looked like a small bump.

meanings.sent1: The tuberous plant in the garden produced many potatoes.
meanings.sent2: The tuberous roots spread underground to store energy.
meanings.sent3: The tuberous tubers were so big they needed two hands to carry.
meanings.sent4: Her tuberous garden yielded a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent5: The tuberous stems of the plant grew thick and strong.

meanings.sent1: The tuberous plant had multiple tubers growing from its base.
meanings.sent2: The tuberous growth on the vine was ready for harvest.
meanings.sent3: The tuberous tubers were the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: Her tuberous crop was the envy of the other farmers.
meanings.sent5: The tuberous roots of the tree provided stability in the soil.
